pullRequest.body:
Replaces `TypeMax` limit constructions in `MonCat`, `GroupCat`, `Ring`, `AlgebraCat` and `ModuleCat` by the `UnivLE` analogs. Also generalizes some universe assumptions.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #11419

Note that the `MonCatMax` etc. `abbrev`s are kept for the time being, since they are still used in some other files (mostly the corresponding colimit files). Entirely getting rid of `MonCatMax` and friends remains a TODO to not make the diff even bigger.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11419~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Since #11487 and #11148 we know that the limit of a functor to types `F` exists iff `Small F.sections`. Then, it should be possible to show existence of limits in other concrete categories under the weaker assumption that this smallness property holds for the functor obtained by composition with the forget functor. Do you think your PR could be generalized accordingly? (I am referring to limits only, not colimits.)

(In future PRs, we may even add that a limit in the category of rings (for example) exists iff it exists after applying the forget functor. Then, it would be possible to show that these forget functor commute to all limits, without any restriction on universes. This would be convenient in the development of API for (pre)sheaves of modules.)

> Since #11487 and #11148 we know that the limit of a functor to types `F` exists iff `Small F.sections`. Then, it should be possible to show existence of limits in other concrete categories under the weaker assumption that this smallness property holds for the functor obtained by composition with the forget functor. Do you think your PR could be generalized accordingly? (I am referring to limits only, not colimits.)

See the latest commit.

Thanks for this effort!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8409802482/job/23027521202)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8409802482/job/23027521238)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8409802482/job/23027521274)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Algebra/Category): replace `TypeMax` constructions by `UnivLE` assumptions
